content.content: This thread is for discussion of EIP 1844, ENS Interface Discovery.
content.GPT-summary: The post is a discussion thread for EIP 1844, which proposes ENS Interface Discovery. The author is seeking feedback and the post is open for discussion. Some third parties are asking questions about the proposal, while others may be reviewing it.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This is a very useful standard. It could replace 165. Please add a note that a contract could designate itself as the implementer by returning its own address. Backwards compatibility section could please be updated to add notes about 1820, specifically the cache. And about how this can replace 165. Use case could be much more general if interface was changed from (bytes32 node, bytes4 interfaceID) into just a single bytes32 interfaceID. hash(bytes32 || bytes4) == bytes32. Now this is useful for much more than just ENS. A brief prescription could be given for how to convert ERC-165 style interfaces into the new 32byte interfaces (related to ERC-820). Personally, I think this is immediately more useful than ERC-165 and solves most use cases of ERC-820 and ERC-1820.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal
None of the topics listed match
